
Use update_coin_list_Rda.Rmd if you want to update the history data file to today's date. ~15 min to update. Currently can only go up to Feb 10, 2018.
This only takes into consideration of top 50 coins in marketcap value.


#### How to use generate_comparison function####
comparison_date:
    The specific reference date that you want for all other dates to compare to. "YYYY-MM-DD" format.
    
end_date:
    The furthest date in the time interval you want to compare with. "YYYY-MM-DD" format.

month_or_day:
    "day" = [DEFAULT] Looks at all the days between the start date and end date.
    "month" = Looks at all the months between the start date and end date

interval:
    Takes a number as the argument. The interval number of months or days the start to end date is divided by. Default value is 1.

time:
    "-" = [DEFAULT] compares previous prices to the end date price.
    "+" = compare prices since the start date price.

type:
    "marketcap" = [DEFAULT] sorts dataset by marketcap (descending).
    "percent" = sorts each column of dataset by the coin with the highest gain since that month.
    "name" = sorts dataset by coin name.
    "nopercent" = sorts dataset by marketcap (descending) without percent or name labels.
```{r}
setwd("~/Desktop/Crypto_Analysis-master")
source("check_packages.R")
check_packages(c("sjPlot"))
source("custom_functions.R")


output = generate_comparison(comparison_date = "2017-10-10", end_date = "2018-02-10", month_or_day = "day", interval = 10, type = "percent")
View(output)
sjPlot::tab_df(output, title = "Cryptocurrencies With the Highest Percent Price Increase for Each Month Compared to October 10, 2017", alternate.rows=TRUE ) 
```
